text: st. Martin of Tours grammar school
closed this week after serving the
Crotona community for eighty-six years
it's one of six Bronx schools being
shuttered by the archdiocese because of
shrinking enrollments and growing
deficits I graduated from st. Martin's
in 1971 right when the neighborhood
began to be buffeted by blight I
returned in recent weeks to witness a
school that has shrunk in size but not
its mission to uplift the poor the
closings have brought great pain to the
parents and children who see these
schools as family but for some teachers
the roots weren't even deeper I have
been teaching here for 20 years my
father went to school here my mother
started as the school secretary in in
the fall of 1957 of my grandmother
attended the grotto my uncle and my
father sang in the choir and then I came
to work and now my daughter's working I
think the children have a safe place to
come a lot of them have working parents
and this is their constant in their life
it's always been here and now it's gonna
be gone
Christine Altschuler doesn't know where
she'll be working in September none of
the teachers from st. Martin's as a new
job parish schools are retrenching and
the public schools aren't hiring I feel
like I like I'm losing a member of my
family it's like a death in the family
and I'm devastated so many lives are
going to be changed not many for the
better
